newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Omni Media sees real 1996/97 shr growth.
newsitem.headline: Omni Media sees real 1996/97 shr growth.

text.p: South African media firm Omni Media Corp Ltd said on Wednesday earnings in the 1996/97 year should reflect real growth provided there were no further negative impacts on consumer confidence.

It said in a statement the outlook for its publishing interests, which include newspaper and magazine business Times Media Ltd, for the rest of the year appeared reasonable despite the increasingly competitive market.
But the retail and entertainment sector, which includes its holding in CNA Gallo Ltd, anticipated a continuation of tough trading conditions.
"This sector relies heavily on the second half performance and the achievement of turnover in the Christmas and 'Back to School' seasons," it said.
Omni Media on Wednesday announced headline earnings for the six months to end September rose to 113 cents a share from 86 cents before. The dividend was upped to 22 cents from 19.
The company concluded: "Provided there are no further negative impacts on consumer confidence, earnings for the year should reflect real growth."
